word_mean: 胃：食道和十二指肠间的消化道肌膜膨大部
胃，六腑之一。位于中焦，其上口为贲门，下口为幽门。其主要生理功能是受纳与腐熟饮食物。

sentence.Network_en: She dropped out after 20 kilometres with stomach trouble.
sentence.Network_cn: 20公里后她因胃痛而退出了比赛。

sentence.Network_en: My bulging thighs and flabby stomach made me depressed.
sentence.Network_cn: 我大腿太粗，肚子上也净是赘肉，让我很发愁。

sentence.Network_en: Foods and fluids are mixed in the stomach by its muscular contractions.
sentence.Network_cn: 通过胃部肌肉的收缩食物和流质在胃中混合。

list.abs: 对于这些害虫一般采用胃毒剂(stomach poison) 或触杀剂(contact poison)进行防治。对于蛀茎、潜叶或蛀果等钻蛀性害虫,因只是短时间暴露在外,故施药时间应掌握在.

jx.jx_en_mean: a group of soldiers or workers can only fight or function effectively if they have been well fed
jx.jx_cn_mean: 给养充足的士兵（或工人）才能很好地战斗（或工作）

phrase.cizu_name: on a full (或 an empty) stomach

jx.jx_en_mean: after having eaten (or having not eaten)

lj.lj_ly: I think better on a full stomach.
lj.lj_ls: 我吃饱了才能更好地思考。

jx.jx_en_mean: an ability to see or do unpleasant things without feeling sick or squeamish
jx.jx_cn_mean: （看或做讨厌的事时）坚强的性格

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French estomac, stomaque, via Latin from Greek stomakhos 'gullet', from stoma 'mouth'. The early sense of the verb was 'be offended at, resent' (early 16th cent.)

entry.def: Your stomach is the organ inside your body where food is digested before it moves into the intestines.
You can refer to the front part of your body below your waist as your stomach .

example.ex: The children lay down on their stomachs.

entry.def: If the front part of your body below your waist feels uncomfortable because you are feeling worried or frightened, you can refer to it as your stomach .

example.tran: 他的五脏六腑都揪在一起了。

entry.tran: (对令人反胃的东西的)承受能力
entry.def: If you say that someone has a strong stomach, you mean that they are not disgusted by things that disgust most other people.

example.ex: Surgery often demands actual physical strength, as well as the possession of a strong stomach.
example.tran: 做外科手术常常要求有真正的体力和很强的承受恶心反胃的能力。

entry.def: If you cannot stomach something, you cannot accept it because you dislike it or disapprove of it.

example.ex: I could never stomach the cruelty involved in the wounding of animals.
example.tran: 我永远都无法忍受伤害动物时的那种残忍。

entry.def: If you do something on an empty stomach, you do it without having eaten.

example.ex: Avoid drinking on an empty stomach.

entry.def: If you have no stomach for something, you do not have the courage to do it.

example.ex: America has no stomach for a fight...
The surgeon didn't have the stomach to look at Kelly's face.
example.tran: 外科医生不敢看凯莉的脸。

entry.def: If you say that you feel sick to your stomach about something, you mean that you feel very angry or upset about it.

example.ex: She felt sick to her stomach just thinking about it.
example.tran: 她一想到这事就气不打一处来。

entry.tran: 令人倒胃口;使人感到恶心
entry.def: If you say that something turns your stomach or makes your stomach turn, you mean that it is so unpleasant or offensive that it makes you feel sick.

example.ex: The true facts will turn your stomach...
I saw the shots of what happened on television and my stomach just turned over.
example.tran: 我从电视上看到了那些镜头，觉得很恶心。

means.word_mean: 1. an enlarged and muscular saclike organ of the alimentary canal; the principal organ of digestion
2. the region of the body of a vertebrate between the thorax and the pelvis
3. an inclination or liking for things involving conflict or difficulty or unpleasantness;

sentences.sentence: "he had no stomach for a fight"
"exercise gave him a good stomach for dinner"

means.word_mean: 2. put up with something or somebody unpleasant;

sentences.sentence: "The new secretary had to endure a lot of unprofessional remarks"
"She stuck out two years in a miserable marriage"

auth_sentence.res_content_con: She looks in her eyes and palpates her stomach.

auth_sentence.content: A sick plunge at the apex of your stomach.

Sentence.sentence: Yet due to poor practices in harvesting, storage and transportation, as well as market and consumer wastage, it is estimated that 30-50% of all food produced never reaches a human stomach.

sentences.en: I often feel a pain in my stomach.
I hit him in the stomach.

jushi.english: He has no stomach for swimming.
I hit him in the stomach.
